text.2: SomaLogic (NASDAQ: SLGC) was founded in 2000 with the goal of improving the well-being and quality of life of every individual by transforming how diseases were detected, diagnosed and managed. Building on decades of aptamer research, SomaLogic scientists developed a ground-breaking proteomics technology that overcomes the significant challenges of existing protein measuring technologies, with multiple applications across the biological and medical sciences.
text.3: Our mission is to leverage our proprietary technology to create, develop and commercialize innovative life science research tools and breakthrough clinical products that transform healthcare.
text.4: We are seeking a highly motivated and passionate R tools developer to work with the Bioinformatics group at SomaLogic. Our primary goal is to identify patterns in our high dimensional proteomic data so that we can characterize a variety of different clinical health issues. We employ, develop, and use a wide range of statistical methods and machine learning/AI tools to understand how proteomics can predict different disease outcomes. In addition to our analytical work, we rely heavily on good communication skills, as we collaborate extensively with other groups at SomaLogic.
text.5: This is an opportunity to work at the forefront of biomarker discovery as well as the development and use of new analytical tools.

li: Develop modular, shared, testable, and reusable statistical software tools in R based on user needs.
li.1: Develop R tools for performing statistical and machine learning techniques for the analysis of high-dimensional data.
li.2: Develop reproducible reporting tools in RMarkdown.
li.3: Organize and disseminate information within Bioinformatics around available R tools.

text: Communicate project status updates to stakeholders on a regular basis.

text.6: Bachelors + 2 years relevant work experience or Masters/Ph.D. in Statistics, Biostatistics, Epidemiology, Bioinformatics, or related field.
text.7: The ideal candidate likes to collaborate, learn from others, and is generally curious. We are a group of individuals who genuinely enjoy our jobs and working with each other, so are looking for the right person to join our team.

li: Deep knowledge of R, including extensive experience with development and use of shareable functions
li.1: Experience translating user needs to development of tools and shareable software in R.

text: Must be driven to work in a self-directed manner across team disciplines.

li: Experience developing or maintaining R packages.
li.1: Experience working with version control software (e.g., GitHub).

text: Experience analyzing data in a health science or clinical field.

text.8: This position involves extended time at a computer, frequent informal meetings and discussions with project managers and other analysts, and frequent interactions with collaborators. Multiple hours per day of keyboarding time will be required.

text.11: At SomaLogic, we recognize the key to success is having empowered team members. We value our employees and aim to retain and attract talent by offering competitive benefits. One thing that sets us apart is that our medical, dental, vision, short- & long-term disability plans and life insurance premiums are 100% paid by the company. We also offer competitive paid time off plans, including vacation in which employees accrue 15 days per year to start. Employees also receive 11 paid company holidays, 1 personal floating holiday, a volunteer day, and 10 sick days. In the summer, we offer half day paid leave every Friday. In addition, we offer 401(k) matching at 4%, FSA=E2=80=99s, tuition reimbursement, stock options, and an employee assistance program.
